marketNews.title: ðŸš— Wholesales Car Sales -3% YoY in 4M25
marketNews.content: Gaikindo recorded that national car wholesales in April 2025 reached 51,205 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM). This result caused the wholesales realization for 4M25 to become 256,368 units (-3% YoY), relatively in line with expectations, equivalent to 28-34% of Gaikindo's 2025 target in the range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 4M24: 30% of 2024 realization). Astra International ($ASII) itself recorded a sale of 26,976 units in April 2025 (+0% YoY, -29% MoM), growing lower compared to the industry, so ASII's market share dropped to 52.7% (vs. Apr 2024: 55.2%, Mar 2025: 53.2%). ASII car wholesales in April 2025 were supported by Toyota + Lexus sales of 16,268 units (+5% YoY, -28% MoM), while Daihatsu sales were suppressed to 8,884 units (-6% YoY, -32% MoM). Cumulatively, ASII car wholesales during 4M25 fell to 137,788 units (-6% YoY), with market share dropping to 53.7% (vs. 4M24: 55.5%). The still solid growth in hybrid electric vehicle (HEV) sales is supporting Toyota's sales. Nevertheless, the significant growth in battery electric vehicle (BEV) sales has caused the BEV segment to surpass HEV sales as of 1Q25. The rapid growth of BEV is also reflected in the sales of BYD + Denza and Chery. As of April 2025, the market share of BYD + Denza and Chery has increased to 8.4% and 3.2% respectively, up from the ~2% level recorded by both in December 2024. BYD's market share has made it the 4th largest selling brand in Indonesia as of April 2025, despite only entering Indonesia in mid-2024. Key Takeaway: The comparison of annual sales in April 2025 is also influenced by the effect of the shift in Lebaran seasonality. If only using sales in March and April 2025, total national car wholesales in those two months dropped slightly by -1% YoY to 122,100 units. Although still declining, we assess that this weak sales condition is already expected by the market.

tickerNews.title: TOTL: Dividend Rp75/Share, Contract Value +16% YoY in 4M25
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 255.8 billion rupiah or 75 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~96% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 9.7% as of Thursday (15/5). The cum date for the regular and negotiation markets is May 23, 2025, while the payment date is June 18, 2025. In addition to dividends, TOTL's Corporate Secretary, Anggie S. Sidharta, stated on Thursday (15/5) that the company recorded new contract value of 2.15 trillion rupiah during 4M25 (+16.2% YoY), equivalent to 43% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Grab Indonesia declines to comment on rumors of merger with GOTO
tickerNews.content: Grab Indonesia's Chief of Public Affairs, Tirza Munusamy, stated on Thursday (15/5) that they are reluctant to comment on the rumors of an acquisition of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia. Tirza said that the circulating speculation is not based on verified information.

tickerNews.title: MYOR plans a share buyback up to IDR 1 Trillion, separate from existing buyback
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 1 trillion rupiah, although the company did not specify the number of shares to be purchased. This plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on June 4, 2025, with the buyback period from June 5, 2025, to June 5, 2026. This corporate action is separate from the existing buyback, which is carried out without requiring a GMS following relaxation from OJK to support Indonesian capital market stability. The existing buyback which also allocates funds up to 1 trillion rupiah is scheduled to be completed on May 28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ADRO postpones share buyback execution schedule following AGM date change
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia announced that the share buyback period will be postponed, following the change in the schedule of the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPST) from May 15, 2025, to June 2, 2025. With this change, the buyback plan with a fund allocation of up to 4 trillion rupiah will commence on June 3, 2025, and will run for 12 months.

tickerNews.title: BBCA accelerates share buyback program ending on May 15, 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia announced that the company is accelerating the end of its share buyback period from June 24, 2025, to May 15, 2025 (in the first trading session). This step was taken because the condition of the Indonesian capital market and the company's stock price have been relatively stable. Previously, BBCA announced it would conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 1 trillion rupiah starting from May 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TINS seeks DPR support to become the sole tin seller in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Timah Director, Nur Adi Kuncoro, on Wednesday (14/5) requested support from the DPR to issue a legal basis for the company to become the sole seller of tin in the country. Nur explained that with such regulation, TINS would have a strong legal basis to determine prices or become a price maker, thereby contributing more to state revenue. Kontan reported that Commission VI of the DPR supports the issuance of a presidential regulation concerning critical minerals and strategic minerals and or other derivative regulations governing TINS' authority as the sole marketer of tin sales.

tickerNews.title: SGRO to distribute 2024 dividend of Rp330/Share, yielding 10.6%
tickerNews.content: Sampoerna Agro will distribute a dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 600 billion rupiah or 330 rupiah per share, equivalent to an ~80% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 10.6% as of Thursday (15/5). The cum date for the regular and negotiation markets is May 21, 2025, while the payment date is June 5, 2025.

tickerNews.title: TPIA's JV signs cooperation agreement with Sembcorp Industries in Singapore for energy and utilities
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific, through its joint venture with Glencore, Aster Chemicals and Energy, signed a cooperation agreement with Sembcorp Industries in the field of energy and utilities. In this cooperation, Sembcorp will supply a full range of gas, electricity, and utility solutions worth US$650 million for Aster, which operates a refining complex and chemical plant in Pulau Bukom and Pulau Jurong, Singapore. Besides the commercial agreement, Sembcorp and Aster also signed a Memorandum of Understanding valid for 6 months to explore strategic initiatives in Singapore, Indonesia, and throughout Southeast Asia.

tickerNews.title: US and Chinese trade negotiators meet in South Korea following partial tariff agreement
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that US and Chinese officials held trade negotiations in South Korea on Thursday (15/5), a few days after both countries agreed to reduce their respective tariffs by 115 percentage point over 90 days. Nevertheless, there are no details regarding these negotiations yet, and the US Embassy in South Korea has not commented on this news.

tickerNews.title: US President Trump indicates closeness to reaching nuclear deal with Iran
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, stated on Thursday (15/5) that the US is closer to reaching an agreement with Iran to limit Iran's nuclear program. Trump's statement came after the Supreme Leader's advisor in Iran, Ali Shamkhani, affirmed that Iran is willing to limit uranium enrichment if the US provides sanctions relief.

tickerNews.title: COVID-19 cases spike in Singapore; Hong Kong also sees increase
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported on Thursday (15/5) that health authorities in Singapore recorded a 28% WoW spike in Covid-19 cases, reaching 14,200 during the week ending May 3, 2025, with daily hospitalizations increasing around +30% WoW. The Singapore Ministry of Health noted that although the increase in Covid-19 cases may be caused by the factor of declining population immunity, there is no indication that the circulating variant is more easily transmitted than during the pandemic.

tickerNews.title: ESDM announces Reference Coal Price (HBA) for the second period of May 2025 drops by 8.2% MoM
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources announced that the Reference Coal Price (HBA) for the second period of May 2025 fell by -8.2% MoM to US$110.38 per ton. This price is also -8.9% lower compared to the HBA for the first period of May 2025.

tickerNews.title: Government explores increasing lithium import portion from Australia for EV battery projects
tickerNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that the government is opening opportunities to increase the portion of lithium imports from Australia for electric vehicle (EV) battery projects, although this plan is still tentative and depends on the needs of smelters in the Morowali Industrial Estate, Central Sulawesi. Airlangga mentioned that this issue was one of the topics discussed in the meeting between President Prabowo Subianto and the Prime Minister of Australia, Anthony Albanese, on Thursday (15/5). Currently, Indonesia imports 70,000-80,000 tons of lithium per year from Australia.

tickerNews.title: HILL Controller sells 56 million shares resulting in ownership decrease
tickerNews.content: Hillcon's controller, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 56 million HILL shares at a price of 296 rupiah per share on May 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached 16.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Hillcon Equity Management in HILL decreased from 57.13% to 56.75%.

tickerNews.title: PANR Controller increases ownership after purchasing 9 million shares
tickerNews.content: Panorama Sentrawisata's controller, PT Panorama Tirta Anugerah, purchased 9 million PANR shares at a price of 750 rupiah per share on May 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Panorama Tirta Anugerah in PANR increased from 44.25% to 44.9%.
